The AM_SAMPLE2_PROPERTIES structure describes the properties of a media sample. The interface uses this structure.

member.name: AM_SAMPLE2_PROPERTIES.cbData
member.summary: Length of property data, in bytes. This structure member is for extensibility.

summary.para: Type-specific flags. Flags are defined separately for each media type. The default value is AM_VIDEO_FLAG_INTERLEAVED_FRAME (zero). The following flags are used for video streams. They are defined in the header file dvdmedia.h.

listheader.description: Use this mask to check whether the sample is a field or a frame.
The sample is a frame. (Use the AM_VIDEO_FLAG_FIELD_MASK bitmask to test for this value.)
The sample is field 1. (Use the AM_VIDEO_FLAG_FIELD_MASK bitmask to test for this value.)
The sample is the field 2. (Use the AM_VIDEO_FLAG_FIELD_MASK bitmask to test for this value.)
If this flag is set, display field 1 first. Otherwise, display field 2 first. (Applies only when there are two fields per sample.)
If this flag is set, use weave mode (that is, do not deinterlace the sample). Otherwise, use bob mode. This flag applies only when there are two fields per sample.
If this flag is set, display the first field again after displaying the second field. (Applies only when there are two fields per sample.)
Signals the start of a VOBU during reverse playback of DVD video. For more information, see DVD Playback Enhancements in Windows Vista.

Signals the end of a VOBU during reverse playback of DVD video. The DVD Navigator sets this flag on an empty sample to signal the end of a VOBU. For more information, see DVD Playback Enhancements in Windows Vista.

For DVD playback, indicates the point in the stream when the decoder should apply a new Content Scramble System (CSS) key.
The DVD Navigator sets this flag on an empty media sample just before it renegotiate a CSS title key.
Previously, the DVD Navigator incorrectly sent this key before negotiating the disc key. Starting in Windows 7, if the decoder's AM_PROPERTY_DVDCOPY_SUPPORTS_NEW_KEYCOUNT property returns TRUE, the DVD Navigator does not send this flag before negotiating the disc key. See DVD Copy Protection Property Set.

summary.para: Other flags are defined but not currently used. See dvdmedia.h.

member.name: AM_SAMPLE2_PROPERTIES.dwSampleFlags
member.summary: Bitwise combination of flags the enumerated data type. Undefined bits are reserved and must be zero.

member.name: AM_SAMPLE2_PROPERTIES.lActual
member.summary: Length of the valid data in the buffer.

member.name: AM_SAMPLE2_PROPERTIES.tStart
member.summary: Start time, if valid. The dwSampleFlags member specifies whether this member is valid.

member.name: AM_SAMPLE2_PROPERTIES.tStop
member.summary: Stop time, if valid. The dwSampleFlags member specifies whether this member is valid.

member.name: AM_SAMPLE2_PROPERTIES.dwStreamId
member.summary: Stream identifier. If the value is AM_STREAM_MEDIA, the stream contains media data. If the value is AM_STREAM_CONTROL, the stream contains control information. Applications can define values of 0x80000000 or greater for their own use. (See .)

member.name: AM_SAMPLE2_PROPERTIES.pMediaType
member.summary: Pointer to an structure that specifies the media type if the format has changed. If this format has not changed, this member is NULL.

member.name: AM_SAMPLE2_PROPERTIES.cbBuffer
member.summary: Size of the sample buffer, in bytes.
